Linux

Obtain Necessary Tools

You should use the toolkit from NVidia (no matter what card you have). Please note that there are no cg libraries for PPC processors. If you are on a PPC processor it is safe to skip this step but you will possibly encounter a few graphics anomalies.

For x86 (32bit) 

# wget http://developer.download.nvidia.com/cg/Cg_1.5/1.5.0/Cg-1.5_x86.tar.gz

For x86_64 (64bit) 

# wget http://download.nvidia.com/developer/cg/Cg_1.5/1.5.0023/Cg-1.5_x86_64.tar.gz

Next copy the file to your root directory. 

# sudo mv Cg-1.5_*.tar.gz /

The next step is extracting it, then removing the old .gz file. Note change the filename if you are on a different architecture than x86 

# cd /

# sudo tar -zxf Cg-1.5_*.tar.gz

# sudo rm Cg-1.5_*.tar.gz

Ubuntu gutsy

Before you start building Peragro Tempus from source, you need to make sure that you have several development packages installed. The instructions here are tested using Ubuntu Gutsy Linux.
Please Note, this guide is for Ubuntu Gutsy though it should work as a reference guide for most linux distro's.
Since Gutsy is installed by default with minimal packages, many required packages are not installed. This command should install all necessary packages. You will also need your universe and multiverse repositories enabled. To enable these do the following:
First open a terminal. This is located in Applications ---> Accessories ---> Terminal This will open a command prompt in which you are going to be typing the following commands. Don't close it accidentally like I do all the time! 

# sudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list

Delete everything in it that you haven't added yourself (which is often everything in the file), and paste the following into the file and save it: 


 # Ubuntu supported packages
 # GPG key: 437D05B5
 deb http://us.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu gutsy main restricted
 deb http://us.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu gutsy-updates main restricted
 deb http://security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu gutsy-security main restricted
 
 # Ubuntu community supported packages
 # GPG key: 437D05B5
 deb http://us.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu gutsy universe multiverse
 deb http://us.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu gutsy-updates universe multiverse
 deb http://security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu gutsy-security universe multiverse

 # Ubuntu backports project
 # GPG key: 437D05B5
 deb http://us.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu gutsy-backports main restricted universe multiverse

Now we need to double check that the gpg keys are added correctly to avoid gpg errors. Sounds scary, but worry not! All it takes is one simple command: 

# gpg --keyserver hkp://subkeys.pgp.net --recv-keys 437D05B5 &&  gpg --export --armor 437D05B5 | sudo apt-key add -

After that we need to refresh our sources.list file like so: 

# sudo apt-get update

Once that is completed, we can now fetch all packages that are needed using the following command: 

# sudo apt-get --assume-yes install libjpeg62-dev x11proto-gl-dev autoconf jam bison flex-old automake1.9 libcurl4-openssl-dev libmng-dev libmikmod2-dev libogg-dev libvorbis-dev zlib1g-dev libpng12-dev build-essential libtool libglu1-mesa-dev libglu1-xorg-dev xserver-xorg-dev libxt-dev libopenal0a libopenal-dev subversion zlibc libttf2 libfreetype6-dev libfreetype6 libasound2-dev alsa-oss libxxf86vm-dev libxext-dev x11proto-xext-dev libboost-dev libboost-python-dev libxerces27-dev libode0-dev swig libpcre3-dev

Redhat (Fedora) 

 yum groupinstall "Development Tools" "Development Libraries" 

 chcon -t textrel_shlib_t $CRYSTAL/out/linuxx86/debug/libs/libcrystalspace-1.3.so

Getting source files

All the following commands are run as a normal user and Peragro Tempus will be built for that user only.

Choose a base directory for your installation. Peragro Tempus will be installed into a subdirectory peragro in the base directory and it can be your home directory. I prefer to install in /opt/peragro_svn and so the guide will reflect this. First create your directory using sudo, then give yourself permission to write there. 

# sudo mkdir /opt/peragro_svn

Chamge ownership so that you can write in the directory and access it. Substitute "mysuername" with your real username. 

# sudo chown myusername:users /opt/peragro_svn

You should now change to your working directory. 

# cd /opt/peragro_svn

Checking out sources from SVN repositories

Get the Peragro Tempus sources. 

peragro_svn $ svn co https://cyanox.nl/peragro/trunk peragro

Download Cal3D library sources. 

peragro_svn $ svn co -r 407 http://svn.gna.org/svn/cal3d/trunk cal3d

Download CrystalSpace sources. 

peragro_svn $ svn co https://crystal.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/crystal/CS/trunk CS_latest

Download Crystal Entity Layer (CEL) 

peragro_svn $ svn co https://cel.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/cel/cel/trunk CEL_latest

Download CeGui sources. 

peragro_svn $ wget -c http://superb-east.dl.sourceforge.net/sourceforge/crayzedsgui/CEGUI-0.5.0b.tar.gz

peragro_svn $ tar -xf CEGUI-0.5.0b.tar.gz

peragro_svn $ rm CEGUI-0.5.0b.tar.gz

Building

Create a profile file that sets all the necessary environment variables. Save the file with the name profile in the Peragro Tempus directory. Make sure to change /opt/peragro_svn to whatever path you choose to make if you decided to go with a different directory than I did. 

peragro_svn $ gedit /opt/peragro_svn/profile

Then copy and paste the following line into the file then save it. 


export CRYSTAL=/opt/peragro_svn/CS_latest
export CEL=/opt/peragro_svn/CEL_latest
export CSCONFPATH=/opt/peragro_svn/CEL_latest
export CAL3D=/opt/peragro_svn/cal3d/cal3d
export CEGUI=/opt/peragro_svn/CEGUI-0.5.0
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/opt/peragro_svn/cal3d/cal3d/src/cal3d/.libs/:$CEGUI/lib:/opt/peragro_svn/CS_latest/:/opt/peragro_svn/CEL_latest/:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH

Then load the profile. You have to reload the profile every time you exit the console and start another one. 

Peragro Tempus $ source profile

Build the Cal3D library. 

peragro_svn $ cd /opt/peragro_svn/cal3d/cal3d

peragro_svn/cal3d/cal3d $ autoreconf --install --force

peragro_svn/cal3d/cal3d $ ./configure --prefix=$CAL3D

peragro_svn/cal3d/cal3d $ make

peragro_svn/cal3d/cal3d $ make install

If the make command ends with an error then enter the following command 

Peragro Tempus $ sed -i 's/all_libraries = @all_libraries@/#all_libraries = @all_libraries@/' /opt/Peragro Tempus_svn/Peragro Tempus/cal3d/cal3d/src/cal3d/Makefile.am

Then rerun configure and make and make install.

Build CeGui 

peragro_svn/cal3d/cal3d $ cd /opt/peragro_svn/CEGUI-0.5.0

peragro_svn/CEGUI-0.5.0 $ ./configure --prefix=$CEGUI

peragro_svn/CEGUI-0.5.0 $ make

peragro_svn/CEGUI-0.5.0 $ make install

Build CrystalSpace. 

peragro_svn/CEGUI-0.5.0 $ cd /opt/peragro_svn/CS_latest

peragro_svn/CS_latest $ ./configure --without-java --without-lib3ds --without-libaws --with-cal3d=$CAL3D --with-CEGUI=$CEGUI

Note: If you want to compile with optimizations for your specific processor, add the following tag to the configure command above. Be warned this may make things less stable. 

--enable-cpu-specific-optimizations

Note: If you want to compile debug enabled, add the following tag to the configure command above. Be warned this may make things slower. 

--enable-debug

peragro_svn/CS_latest $ jam -aq libs plugins cs-config cs-config-1.3 walktest

Build Crystal Entity Layer. 

peragro_svn/CS_latest $ cd /opt/peragro_svn/CEL_latest

peragro_svn/CEL_latest $ ./autogen.sh

peragro_svn/CEL_latest $ ./configure

Note: If you want to compile with optimizations for your specific processor, add the following tag to the configure command above. Be warned this may make things less stable. 

--enable-cpu-specific-optimizations

peragro_svn/CEL_latest $ jam -aq libs plugins cel-config

Build Peragro Tempus. 

peragro_svn/CEL_latest $ cd /opt/peragro_svn/peragro

peragro_svn/peragro $ ./autogen.sh

peragro_svn/peragro $ ./configure --with-CEGUI=$CEGUI

peragro_svn/peragro $ jam -q

If everything went right you should now have a fully compiled client rearing and ready to go!

Now go to Installation#Running_Peragro
